page.title: 06AMENITIES
page.content: THE INHABITANTS OF THE BLOCK MAY APPEAR TO BE ISOLATED BUT THEY ENJOY MODERN AMENITIES PRINCIPALLY FROM NEW RADNOR VILLAGE. MOST HOUSES HAVE A TELEPHONE AND THERE IS A DAILY DELIVERY OF MAIL. CONSUMER GOODS MAY BE BOUGHT IN KINGTON SIX MILES AWAY BUT EVERYDAY SHOPPING IS DONE IN THE VILLAGE WHERE A SMALL FAMILY BAKERY BAKES BREAD AND CAKES AND SELLS GROCERIES. ANOTHER SHOP HAS A WIDER VARIETY OF GROCERIES AND ALSO SELLS FRESH WELSH LAMB, HOME-MADE SAUSAGES AND BEEFBURGERS. ROADS ARE WELL MAINTAINED BY THE COUNTY COUNCIL INCLUDING SNOW CLEARANCE. RUBBISH IS COLLECTED FREQUENTLY. A MOBILE LIBRARY SERVES THE AREA. THE SERVICES ARE ALSO AVAILABLE OF A WATCH REPAIRER, WELDER, SILVERSMITH, AND IN THE VILLAGE, A GARAGE, CRAFT SHOP AND A POST OFFICE.
